name: Embassy Suites Portland - Downtown

reviews.text: What's not to love? It is a clean, green, unique city with historical character as well as modern architecture. Our hotel was terrific....an old, solid, thick-walled beauty that had been renovated with all the updates you would want. The lobby is a sight to behold and the staff were charming and helpful. We had read reviews about the area being a bit rough but didn't find that an issue at all. Our 19 year old son headed out on his own at night and we felt pretty comfortable with that.
reviews.title: We loved Portland!

reviews.text: We parked our car for the four days we were there and just walked or took the bus or tram everywhere. Shopping was great (love not paying sales tax!)....for both new and retro (we had two teenaged kids to please as well)...streets were not too crowded either with cars or people. We ate at everything from the food carts to a lovely little restaurant not far from the hotel... Little Bird or White Bird, perhaps? It was simply amazing and the staff were delightful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location!

reviews.text: The other thing that we really enjoyed that we don't have at home...and was perfect to indulge in on a holiday...was the happy hours! There is a free one in the hotel which is pleasant but there is a great one in the restaurant (very reasonably priced) that we just loved. As long as we sat in a certain area of the restaurant, our kids could sit and eat with us as well.
reviews.title: We liked this place a lot

reviews.text: I would come back to Portland in a flash...and stay at the same hotel again!
reviews.title: What a wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Portland for a wine tasting trip and loved staying here! We had 5 women in one suite and the room was very comfortable - nice big bathroom and comfy beds. Plenty of towels everyday. The complimentary breakfast offered lots of choices including very good cooked-to-order omlettes. The staff was wonderful-very friendly and helpful. Location is ideal- we took the light rail from the airport, so no need for a car. Very close to VooDoo donuts, restaurants and night life. The hotel is historic with lots of character, but the rooms are very contemporary. Highly recommend for anyone visiting the city or venturing out to wine country!
reviews.title: Fun place to stay

reviews.text: Would like to extend a sincere "thank you!" to Josiah McNamara and the rest of the staff at the downtown Portland Embassy Suites. From check-in to check-out, service was nothing short of exceptional, especially during a BUSY holiday weekend. Rooms were clean, spacious and quiet. Hotel was very central to a lot of attractions and conveniences and extremely close to public transportation. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Excellent Service!

reviews.text: We had a great time and enjoyed our stay. Swimming pool was closed due a leak and repair. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. The rooms were cleaned and the breakfast was excellent. The staff was awesome, specially the hotel concierge lady (Zenah!). She tried her best to make our stay and tour around the city easy and comfortable.
reviews.title: Very nice time at Embassy Suites, Portland OR.

reviews.text: Love the beauty and grace of this old hotel, as well as the professionalism of the staff! The rate was a bit high, but since we booked late and got one of the few remaining rooms it was not totally unexpected. Would liked to have seen a few hot items at the manager's reception, but as it is complimentary again not unexpected. Would stay here again if in Portland!
reviews.title: Beautiful historic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Embassy Suites in Downtown Portland and really loved how comfortable the hotel is as well as how close it is to so many great places. We were able to walk just about every place we wanted to go and get to the Tri Met to take the light rail outside of downtown. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Comfortable with a Great Location

reviews.text: We were glad that we were a short distance from the Oregon Beer Fest that was happening over the weekend. Also, Stumptown coffee across the street is a great place for morning coffee. Voodoo Doughnuts is just a block away. In addition, I loved the proximity to the Waterfront so that I could go running in the mornings. If you're a runner, you don't want to miss a nice run along the Willamette River in Portland. It's great.
reviews.title: Question before booking...

reviews.text: Great location, beautiful hotel, and great in-hotel restuarant. We were less than impressed with the exterior, but inside - wow! This place has charm. The staff was very nice and helpful. We never had to ask for anything, but I am sure they would have accomodated. You could just tell. Check in went smooth. Our room was large and very nicely decorated. Bed was comfortable, and the sheets were very nice. I love when hotels have nice crisp clean sheets, and thats exactly what we had. We had a little frig in the room which was nice. We kept our waters in there, so they stayed cold.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: The bathrooms were very nice, clean, and plenty of hot water.Living room area, or whateve its called was nice, too. We had two tvs, both with large flat screens.
reviews.title: Very nice Historic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is amazing - you can get to everything very easy. The restaurant in the hotel was delicious! We really enjoyed this hotel.
reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise ... and sooo close to Voodoo Donuts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the nicest Embassy Suites I've stayed in. The hotel is nearly 100 years old and has kept much of its historic character. The rooms are quite large and the attached restaurant is very good. Great place to stay for business travelers.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel with GREAT Breakfast

reviews.text: Because this hotel is on the Historic Register, the outside doesn't look very exciting but just step into the lobby and you'll know that you have chosen wisely. The location is very, very convenient and surprisingly the in-hotel restaurant, Portland Prime, is excellent!
reviews.title: Always a comfortable stay

reviews.text: We just completed our 1 week stay at this Embassy Suites. Overall our stay was great. Our suite was very roomy with a completely separate bedroom that connected to our living room area. This was so nice as our kids were able to fall asleep soundly on the pullout couch (which was surprisingly comfortable) and my husband and I were able to stay up and have our privacy.
reviews.title: Wonderful for families
Amazing Place to Stay
reviews.text: The lobby was quite large and grand in decoration, the indoor pool was like a roman bath and temperature kept a comfortable level.

The breakfast was steady, the usuals every morning, (bacon, eggs, omelets etc..) the fruit was actually fresh and tasty. The managers reception had a great selection of wines, daily mixed drink and 3 beers. They did have an amazing sangria that I enjoyed daily. The snack spread varied sometimes it was really good with veggies, hummus and guacamole and other days just chips and salsa.
reviews.title: Perfect for families

reviews.text: My only complaint was the staff, especially the valet staff. We had an incident with one of valet people who was very rude. We used the self parking across the street in a very old and narrow parking structure that is difficult to navigate thru and the valet person almost crashed into us and then proceded to scream at my husband . The hotel staff was just really indifferent and not very friendly. Only housekeeping was friendly. Everyone else was kind of bleh.. Its just not the kind of customer service we are used to.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the location is great because its across the street from Voodoo Doughnuts, Stumptown Coffee and other restaurants that are walking distance and close to the river front. But unfortunately there are a ton of homeless youths and the area is kind of dirty and run down.
reviews.title: What a lobby !

reviews.text: This is a wonderhotel-free breakfast-toddy hour & large, spacious rooms! The pool was nice and warm, although the spa didn't bubble, it still was nice and warm. The staff was extreemly friendly also. My ONLY complaint was that internet was slow. But if you are looking for a great hotel-this is it!!!
reviews.title: embassy suites-Portland Oregon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were in Portland for the Portland Marathon, and to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary.
reviews.title: Really Neat Old Hotel with Great Service, & Great Location

reviews.text: We selected this hotel because we had stayed at Embassy Suites in Phoenix several months ago and love it. We were not disappointed, in fact we both agreed the Happy Hour here was better (really good scratch margaritas) and rooms larger than our hotel in Phoenix.
reviews.title: Family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on other users recommendations I requested a corner room and the Front Desk was able to give us a corner room on the 8th floor. It was great, very bright and cheerful.
reviews.title: Good location, okay service...great town!

reviews.text: One of the recent reviews mentioned they felt “a bit "cold" service”, my wife and I observed exactly the opposite, all the staff we came in contact with from the moment we arrived at the Front Desk, to the Room Cleaning Staff, the Happy Hour Staff, and other staff we met at various times during our 3 days were friendly, courteous, and helpful.
reviews.title: customer service leaves much to be desired

reviews.text: We stayed here for only one night, so I can't really write anything for the room service, but I can rant and rave about the location. The location was great! It's really close to everything and Voodoo Donuts is so close! The only beef I had with the hotel is the value. It was just a very spendy.
reviews.title: fabulous location in the heart of downtown portland

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Could be better, but great location

reviews.text: -great location
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, average service

reviews.text: -free breakfast
reviews.title: Worst Stay At a Embassy Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -very close to voodoo donuts
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at Embassy Suites. I felt the room was spacious and comfortable, and I absolutely loved the bedding. It was so cozy after a long day of touring. The fridge was a great bonus and the fact that each room had a television was a plus. With respect to the room, my travel partner disliked that there was no fan in the bathroom. Other than that, we were very happy with the room.
reviews.title: All around wonderful stay

reviews.text: Service was good. The gentlemen at the front of the hotel were helpful when it came to providing directions; that was a plus. Maid service was always good.
reviews.title: Really liked this unique Embassy Suites

reviews.text: Location was fine. I would have liked to have been in an area with more restaurants within sight of the hotel. I know there is a big food cart culture here in Portland, but with my special dietary needs, sit-down service makes getting what I can have a bit easier. Still, we managed. On the plus side, I liked the convenient access to downtown car rentals and the easy access to shopping.
reviews.title: Great location/Charming Old Hotel

reviews.text: All in all, this is a great property and a great option when visiting Portland.
reviews.title: Girl's Getaway

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in early July. We really enjoyed this hotel, including the gorgeous lobby you see as soon as you enter the building. I loved that the hotel is historic, but doesn't sacrifice modern comforts. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. There was ample room in the bathroom and they provided plenty of good towels. There were no issues with hot water, air conditioning or outside noises. We liked having the big screen TVs with several choices of channels. The view from our room was awful, but we didn’t mind. The pool was nice and wasn’t crowded when we were there. Breakfast was great, especially the omelets, although the fruit selection was lacking. The setup was unusual with stations that were placed all throughout the dining area. It seemed to help traffic flow, but you have to go looking for your bread and fruit, etc. The dining area is located in the basement and seemed to provide more than enough seating room to accommodate guests. The only bothersome thing to me during our stay was that it wasn’t evident to me that they had a concierge. I never noticed a desk for one while we were there. Since our trip, I have discovered that they do indeed have a concierge. I had several questions I would have asked if I had known that they had one.
reviews.title: A completely delightful surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really charming old hotel that the Embassy Suites has remodeled. The lobby is lovely and the rooms are quite nice. Staff was very helpful and friendly. There are several good restaurants nearby...but the neighborhood is not the best. It seems to be in a transitional stage. Only gripe was the low lighting in the rooms.
reviews.title: charming old hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights on HHonors points so I can't really address the value. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They printed out directions and called an urgent care center for us to get information. The previous guests had left a jacket in the armoire and as soon as we gave it to the front desk, they were on the radio handling it. Valet was fast and there was always someone there when we were ready to drop off our car. Beautiful historic hotel in a great location. We would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Historic building, exceptionally friendly staff

reviews.text: Great location. Downstairs ding is great close to max line. And blocks from Saturday market. Plus voodoo donuts.
reviews.title: So nice.

reviews.text: We stayed here in August and enjoyed the large rooms and the central location. The staff was helpful and friendly. We didn't bother with the free breakfast as the restaurant is in the basement and it feels like a dungeon. We had breakfast around the corner. There are several alternatives. Our favorite was the Bijou Café. We did stop by for the manager's reception for drinks and a snack - nice touch. Why can't they include free WiFi ?
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Good location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from October 5 through the 10th. The stay was wonderful. Rooms were very spacious, clean, and quiet. In addition, the bed and linen were the best. Housekeeping did a great job on keeping them clean and stocked. The hotel is in great shape for all of the propetiesl areas. ATM and notion store that is well stock is a positive. Another plus was the staff. Check in was abreeze and quick. Everyone was friendly, knowledgeable, and willing to do whatever was needed. This included all staff members, John and company at the front door, Nino and the other front desk help, who doubled as concierges, were second to none (Nino was just terrific with any requst or question thrown her way), and Gary the engineer was eager to please. Several minor problems occurred, a phone that did not work and a pool slightly on the cool side. However, Gary took care of both issues immediately and without any compliant. The pool and pool area were awesome. The located and price were also very good. Overall, this hotel is on par with any other property, including the high end name brands such as Marriot, Hilton, or the Ritz. The $199 price, which included a fabulous made to order breakfast or buffet, a manager reception every night with beer, wine, liquor, and snacks, and there was also free in/out parking cannot be beat (special package). The only area for improvment is related to the hotel's Internet, which was very slow, and with the hot tubs because some of jets needed fixing (which just broke on the second day out 5 party group was there). Would strongly recommend this property to anyone becasue of the room size and ammentities, location, service, and cleaniness.
reviews.title: Perfect

aka: Embassy Suites Portland - Downtown Hotel Portland
description: Located in the heart of downtown Portland, the Historic Embassy Suites Portland -Downtown features large two-room guest suites and a well-known foyer adorned in grandeur and architectural beauty. Built in 1912, the building combines it's original classic style and features along with modern comfort. The hotel is within walking distance of tax-free shopping, restaurants, nightlife, Portland’s revered Voo-Doo doughnuts and Powell’s books. The hotel also offers a luxurious Jacuzzi and Indoor pool for you to warm up to.
